reviews.text: The screw holes do not lineup well with other plates, especially if there are multiple light switches in one faceplate. It took me a really long time and I had to stretch it to make it work. The dimmer works all right for vintage LED with filament… flickers a little no matter how much you adjust.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2024
reviews.title: Doesn’t fit well

reviews.productTitle: GE 3-Way Rotating Dimmer Switch, Push On/Off, Use with Dimmable LED, CFL, and Incandescent Bulbs, Includes Two Knob Colors, UL Listed, White/Light Almond, 18020
reviews.text: I tested the switch with an ohm meter and at first I thought it was broken. No continuity between any of the poles. Hooked it up and switched it quickly on and off. didn't seem to work. Then I realized there must be some built-in electronics because there is a one second delay between switching it on and the lights turning on. Used incandescent lights. Once one gets used to that it works fine otherwise. Maybe electronics is the way they all are nowadays. That's probably why they are all more pricy that 2-way switches. My old switch has stranded pigtails that made it easy to hook up with wire nuts, This one has holes to insert the wires and screws to tighten them down. The wires come loose very easily so you really need to tighten those screws EXTREMELY tight.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2024
reviews.title: Works differently from the older models

reviews.productTitle: GE 3-Way Rotating Dimmer Switch, Push On/Off, Use with Dimmable LED, CFL, and Incandescent Bulbs, Includes Two Knob Colors, UL Listed, White/Light Almond, 18020
reviews.text: I used this to replace a 3 way light dimmer switch that I blew up when reinstalling a ceiling fan that was not installed properly. I had the Ends of the wires capped off but the wire had some insulation missing that I also had to repair. SWITCH was simple. But the Ceiling fan had to have the mounting box installed from the attic. We all know how much fun that was ! But in the end the fan is sturdy and the light has a 3 way with dimmer.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2024
reviews.title: It just works.

reviews.text: I BOUGHT BOTH THESE RHEOSTATS TO REPLACE TWO IN MY HOME. FOOLISH ME I THOUGHT THEY WOULD HAVE CONNECTING WIRES BUT THEY DID NOT! THE SCREWS IN THE RHEAOSTATS WON'T SCREW IN OUT IN ORDER TO CONNECT TO THE WIRES IN THE BOX SO THEY ARE USELESS! I'M NOT IN THE POSITION TO RETURN THEM SO A WASTE OF MONEY AND A HUGE WASTE OF AN HOUR OF MY LIFE!

reviews.title: NEVER, EVER AGAIN!

reviews.productTitle: GE 3-Way Rotating Dimmer Switch, Push On/Off, Use with Dimmable LED, CFL, and Incandescent Bulbs, Includes Two Knob Colors, UL Listed, White/Light Almond, 18020
reviews.text: Handles 6, 15W LED bulbs with ease. Solidly built. Doesn’t dim as low as I would like. Admittedly this could be the bulbs. Also, the power on delay is uncomfortably long. Work around is to simply dim the lamps fully to off rather than turning off the switch. Not an option I like. I’m using this dimmer in single and three-way applications. Love the 3-way functionality - dimmer maintains setting even when I turn my room light off or on by a different switch.

reviews.title: A Robust Dimmer

reviews.productTitle: GE 3-Way Rotating Dimmer Switch, Push On/Off, Use with Dimmable LED, CFL, and Incandescent Bulbs, Includes Two Knob Colors, UL Listed, White/Light Almond, 18020
reviews.text: I bought this to replace a worn-out dimmer switch of the same type. But this one has a 1 to 2 second delay when turning on the light. Long enough to question if it actually clicked on or not. For the first couple days after installing it, I would click it on, pause, then click it again, thinking maybe it didn't work the first time (which would switch it off again). Now I just click it and stand by it shaking my head in anger in the poor craftsmanship of the switch until it finally comes on. It's very aggravating. But it turns off instantly. It's only an issue when turning it on. The old switch didn't do that. The old switch also had a lot more dimming range too. I already knew to never buy a GE appliance, because they only last 4 years tops, but I figured General ELECTRIC would be an ok brand for electric components. It is substantially an all around lesser quality craftsmanship than Leviton dimmer switches. I don't expect it to last even a year (the Leviton switch that it replaced was 12 years old). Plus the knobs that were included were totally different than the ones in the picture, which isn't a big deal, but worth mentioning. I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 because it is a semi-functional device, but it is a very cheaply made switch that I would not recommend wasting your money on. Spend the extra few dollars and get the far superior Leviton switch instead.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2024
reviews.title: Has a 1 to 2 second delay when turning on.

reviews.productTitle: GE 3-Way Rotating Dimmer Switch, Push On/Off, Use with Dimmable LED, CFL, and Incandescent Bulbs, Includes Two Knob Colors, UL Listed, White/Light Almond, 18020
reviews.text: You don't get the same product as you see in the photo with the wires. You get a different version with screws. I take off 2 stars as the info and photo are not what you get... different product. It seems to work fine, but you don't get what you pay for. I didn't take a photo, it's already in the wall.

reviews.productTitle: GE 3-Way Rotating Dimmer Switch, Push On/Off, Use with Dimmable LED, CFL, and Incandescent Bulbs, Includes Two Knob Colors, UL Listed, White/Light Almond, 18020
reviews.text: In the late 60s and early 70s, dimmer switches were new technology. I had one that lasted wellinto the 2000s. This is to replace one that went bad. There are screws on either side that can be used to loop the wires around. Neither could be loosened OR tightened. There are slots in the back that also can be used to fasten the wires, but there is no way to lock the wires into the slots. The face is also not recessed, so the cover plate sits proud of the wall. I was disappointed in the design and engineering of this switch. When I turned it on, the bulbs began blinking. I don't know if I got a defect or if this is the way they all are. Either way, It isn't working correctly.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2024
reviews.title: They Just Don't Make 'Em The Way They Used To!

reviews.productTitle: GE 3-Way Rotating Dimmer Switch, Push On/Off, Use with Dimmable LED, CFL, and Incandescent Bulbs, Includes Two Knob Colors, UL Listed, White/Light Almond, 18020
reviews.text: What I received was different than the pictures on the posting. At first I thought I received the wrong product. When I compared the UPC it was same number. Apparently, this was a cost reduction design. First this was advertised as a 3-way, multiple switch design. It turned out you can use it also for single-switch application. Just have one wire less. It does not come with the wires shown in photo's nor wire nuts. This is where it gets complicated. You have to use the wires you have in the wall and directly connect them to the new dimmer. They actually are pushed into holes and clamped in by tightening the screw terminals. In my case I only have 3 wires and different colors than shown on the dimmer switch. Didn't have a ground wire. I was able to figure out which wires go where, by looking how they were connected to old dimmer switch that had wire nuts. My house is 50 y/o so you might have a different setup. Somone has to change the pictures on posting as they will be different than the old design. Good Luck.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.title: A Bit Challenging.

reviews.text: The new devices do NOT have wires attached for use with screw nuts, etc. like they did a year or so ago. They have bolts on the side and bottom to attach the wires from your house to the device. If your house is like mine, those wires are extremely difficult to pull/bend (and sometimes too short) which makes installing these quite an undertaking - very tedious, time-consuming.

reviews.productTitle: GE 3-Way Rotating Dimmer Switch, Push On/Off, Use with Dimmable LED, CFL, and Incandescent Bulbs, Includes Two Knob Colors, UL Listed, White/Light Almond, 18020
reviews.text: Got a pair of these for my new basement remodel. I also got 3 regular (non 3 way ones). All 5 switches make a humming/ buzzing sound when the lights are dimmed. The lights are dimmable led and the sounds comes from the switch, not the lights. The 3 way switches cannot dim less than 50% or else the lights start to strobe. Also, if you dim the one switch and go to the second switch you cannot increase the light past where the first switch is set to. Basically making the concept of a 3 way dimmer unless. I guess it's a classic case of you get what you pay for. BTW, I'm a professional maintenance worker who's train in the electrical trade. In my professional opinion these switches are junk.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2023
reviews.title: Junk

reviews.text: I tried with two different model dimmable LEDs. Model 1: Very narrow brightness range, and buzzing sound Model 2: Very narrow brigtness range, and flashing at the highest setting (i.e. it's getting overloaded). I think this is a conevntial dimmer designed before LED bulbs, with 'LED compatible' just slapped on. One thing I realize in retrospect - it should have a little wheel inside to adjust the output range, but does not.
